thread.title_full: Family Feud Australia 2015: Worst wrong answers | Bah bow | The Advertiser

author: STAFF WRITERS
title: Family Feud Australia 2015: Worst wrong answers | Bah bow | The
text:
WE GET that they’re under a lot of pressure with the crowd and the cameras and the lights ... but some of the contestants’ answers on Family Feud have been abysmal.
The Network Ten game show , which is this week celebrating it’s first birthday with Grant Denyer at the helm, has already had more than 275 Aussie families appear on the show.
But we’re willing to bet a few of those family members have cringed when watching back their episodes on TV thanks to some truly terrible answers.
For example, how about the time Grant Denyer asked contestants to “Name an animal that starts with the letter A”, and someone responded, “A baboon”.
Or the time he asked them to, “Name something you associate with China,” and a contestant actually replied with, “Thai food”.
And spare a thought for the poor person who tried to answer, “What’s a girl’s name that starts with V?” by hitting their buzzer and saying, “Melissa”.
Earlier this year, we brought you the story of the contestant who anwered “George Bush” when asked to name an Australian Prime Minister. Oh dear. You can read that story here .
For more of the most laughable answers from Family Feud, watch the video above. We’ve transcribed them below as well.
Q: Apart from hello, what’s a popular greeting?
A: Goodbye.
Q: Name something you associate with goats.
A: Neigh.
Q: Name something you associate with trucks.
A: Big trucks.
Q: Name a real or fictional woman who married a prince.
A: Princess ... Leia.
Q: Something you might see at a golf club.
A: Goats.
Q: Name a yellow fruit.
A: Orange.
Q: Name a Christmas present you’ll find hard to wrap.
A: Shooting star.
Q: Something France is famous for.
A: Big Ben.
Q: You can never trust anyone who has a ...
A: Shower.
Q: Name an animal you might see at an African watering hole.
A: Platypus.
Q: Name a type of badge.
A: A chicken.
Q: Name an Australian city starting with B.
A: Berlin.
Q: Name a way of serving prawns.
A: Raw.
Q: Name another word for smart.
A: Dart.
Q: Name a type of bell.
A: Dingle.
Q: Name a word beginning with Q.
A: Knitting.
Family Feud — 6.00pm, Sunday to Friday, on Network Ten
Originally published as The dumbest answers on Family Feud
